definitions.definition: An explicit or formal acknowledgment of ownership or authorship .
examples: The attribution of the quote is widely regarded as dubious.

definitions.definition: A legal doctrine by which liability is extended to a defendant who did not actually commit the tortious or criminal act.

secondary_definitions: An explicit or formal acknowledgment of ownership or authorship .
( law ) A legal doctrine by which liability is extended to a defendant who did not actually commit the tortious or criminal act.
